page.title: 15The Army and the Moor
page.content: The armed forces have used the moor for a considerable time as a gunnery range. Luckily this does not preclude walkers from using the moor for recreation. If firing is taking place then flags will be flown from some of the tors. In this particular case there is a flagpole of Doe Tor, and another on Hare Tor. When these flags are flying, do not enter. If firing is taking place at night then lights are flown from the flagpoles. The limit of the firing range is shown by posts painted white and red. When the flags are flying, the walker may not enter. Also on the moor are several Range Notice Boards. These give information regarding the limit of the range. Finally there are telephone numbers that can be consulted regarding firing
